statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Bryan Mullins scored 22 points and Southern Illinois used a tight defense to send No. 24 Saint Mary's to its first loss Tuesday night, beating the Gaels 71-56.
article.headline: Salukis hold Gaels to season-low 56 points in upset
article.linkText: Unbeaten Saint Mary's runs into Southern Illinois
article.story: CARBONDALE, Ill. (AP) -- Bryan Mullins scored 24 points and Southern Illinois spoiled Saint Mary's first game as a ranked team in 18 years with a 71-56 victory over the 24th-ranked Gaels on Tuesday night. The point total was a season low for Saint Mary's (7-1), which was last ranked in March 1989. Southern Illinois (4-3) ended a three-game losing streak that had knocked the Salukis from the Top 25. Saint Mary's, which trailed 36-24 at halftime, rallied within six points with 4 minutes remaining, but Mullins scored nine points down the stretch and the Salukis held on. Freshman guard Patrick Mills, Saint Mary's leading scorer with a 16.1 average, was held to 11 points. Freshman Brandon Wood was 3-for-4 from 3-point range to lead the Salukis' 6-for-13 effort from behind the arc. Josh Bone and Matt Shaw both had 10 points for Southern Illinois. SIU forced 19 turnovers against the Gaels, who were ranked 13th nationally averaging 83.6 points per game and had consistently approached 100 points all season. Randal Falker, Southern Illinois' leading scorer who was held scoreless in the Salukis' loss at Charlotte on Saturday, scored all eight of his points in the first half Tuesday night and had 12 rebounds. The Gaels' big win this season was a 99-87 victory over No. 16 Oregon on Nov. 20. They also defeated Seton Hall 85-70 in a matchup of unbeaten teams on Dec. 1.
